left_text: Submarginal cells three (occasional individuals have only two) (North and Central America)
Propodeal triangle basally pilose (metasoma often red or largely so) (nearctic)
Hind tibial spurs strongly curved at apices; ﬁrst submarginal cell on posterior margin shorter than second (Chile)
right_text: Hind tibial spurs or at least one of them slightly curved or almost straight; ﬁrst submarginal cell on posterior margin about as long as or longer than second

left_text: Gonostylus less than one-third as long as gonocoxite; S6 scarcely notched apically (face black) (South America)
right_text: Gonostylus over one-half as long as gonocoxite; S6 with deep midapical notch or slit

left_text: Scutum with punctures well marked, many of them separated by spaces larger than their diameters; S6 with midapical emargination narrow, deep (North and Central America)
right_text: Scutum with punctures very small, homogeneous, commonly dense; S6 midapical emargination V-shaped
